definition: to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
not a bit/nothing is up/nothing alarming is happening

sentences.english: I have some problems at home these days could you please ask Mr. Wang for permission to leave?
sentences.chinese: 我這幾天家裏有事，你能幫我向王老師請假嗎？

sentences.english: Just something to do, and continue to look at it the second quarter.
sentences.chinese: 正好有事做了，繼續看二季吧。

sentences.english: Seeing the tent and yak skin boat they know that the three men are in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 看見湖邊的帳篷和牛皮船知道他們有事就過來了。

sentences.english: After that, I called Information, Please for everything.
sentences.chinese: 打那以後，我只要有事，就撥信息臺。

sentences.english: Never shut down you mobile, in case of I am sick , I need you take me to hosipital , stay with me.
sentences.chinese: 唔好關機，萬一半夜我有事要去急症室我想你陪住我。

sentences.english: Every now and then Justin and Audrey also love to doodle on the glass doors with markers.
sentences.chinese: 平時有事沒事大小貝貝還拿彩色筆在玻璃上塗鴉。

sentences.english: The headmaster you find we occupy?
I don't think I've got anything planned. Why?
sentences.chinese: 我想我還沒有計劃要做什麼。你有事嗎？

sentences.english: Here an event occurred to Mademoiselle Gillenormand the elder,-- an idea struck her.
sentences.chinese: 到此，吉諾曼大姑娘感到有事可做了，她有了個想法。

sentences.english: There's always hope, there's always something out there.
Qin and Ning come, but Chen because busy, so he can't come.
sentences.chinese: 秦和寧來了，但是陳因爲有事所以來不了。

sentences.english: What are you doing next Saturday? We're having some people over for a meal.

sentences.chinese: 雲板響了，一定有事發生。

sentences.english: Mimi comfort lesser, grandpa will be fine, jingjing has been blame her.
sentences.chinese: 咪咪安慰小雅，爺爺不會有事，晶晶卻一直在責怪她。

definition: it's not important/it's nothing/never mind/to have nothing to do/to be free/to be all right (out of danger or trouble)
what?/which?
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
to have time (to do sth)
important matter
to have an accident/to meet with a mishap
personal matters
lit. One doesn't visit a temple without a cause. (idiom)/fig. to visit sb with an ulterior motive (esp. to ask for sth)/having a hidden agenda
pinyin: wu2 shi4 bu4 deng1 san1 bao3 dian4

definition: one's proper business
one's employment/business/matter that needs to be settled/(northern dialect) (of a person) demanding/trying/troublesome/erhua variant of 事[shi4]/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
work-related matters/documents
there's no hurry/take one's time
to make a telephone call
(coll.) older sister's husband
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
